sample

Class State

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.State

  • public class State
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the State of the game at each moment: what cards are on the board, what cards are on each hand, how many attack points, health points and lives each creature/hero has, which cards are sleeping, which cards have attacked this turn, which Hero is playing... Moreover, it contains the actions that are admissible by the rules of the game: attack, heal, damage, die, start turn, end turn... It contains a game initializer. Only the state can modify itself, since everything depends on it. That's why the getState function is implemented as a singleton.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  State.Hero
      The Hero is either Hillary Clinton or Donald Trump
      class  State.PlayedCreature
      This class defines the type of cards that have been played and are now on the floor.
      class  State.PlayedSpell
      This class represents the category of played spells.
      static class  State.Target
      This class identifies the general idea of a Target.

      • withTarget

        public static java.lang.Object withTarget(State.Target t,
                                          java.util.function.Function<State.Hero,java.lang.Object> h,
                                          java.util.function.Function<State.PlayedCreature,java.lang.Object> c)
        This function defines the scope of the healing or attack. It first determines whether we need to attack a hero or a creature. Then it applies the action on the target.
        Parameters:
        t - Target
        h - Hero action
        c - Creature action
        Returns:
        Object: unit equivalent of returning void

      • withMana

        public static java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> withMana(State.Hero h,
                                                            java.lang.Integer i,
                                                            java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Optional<java.lang.String>> f)
        Deals with any situation that requires Mana exchange. It makes sure that the mana are deducted correctly, considering whether the hero has enough mana to perform a the action. The input function is then applied on the number of lives available and it deducts the cost by those.
        Parameters:
        h - Hero performing the action
        i - how many mana it costs
        f - function of integer(how many manas are available) and optional
        Returns:
        empty optional if it succeeded, the message error otherwise

      • init

        public boolean init(java.util.ArrayList<Card> democrats,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Card> republicans)
        Match initializer: it assigns the decks, it checks whether there are actually 30 cards and it draws the initial 4 cards assigning them to each player
        Parameters:
        democrats - Democrat deck
        republicans - Republican deck
        Returns:
        True if the init succeeded

      • startTurn

        public void startTurn(State.Hero h)
        Function called to start each turn. It sets up initial condition: it draws a card, updates the status of the turn and whether the hero has already used its power. Then it wakes up every creature.
        Parameters:
        h - Hero

        public void reset()
        Changes the state to an pre-initial state. Used for testing purposes

      • playCard

        protected java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> playCard(State.Hero h,
                                                        Card playedCard,
                                                        java.util.Optional<State.Target> t)
        This function plays a card. It first checks whether the card is a spell card. If it is, it put is in its relative hovering position. If instead it's a creature card, it puts it on its relative floor, after checking whether there is space on the floor. It then adds the action to the combat log
        Parameters:
        h - Hero
        playedCard -
        t - target
        Returns:
        empty optional if the action succeeded, the error message if it didn't

      • tick

        public void tick()

      • useHeroPower

        public java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> useHeroPower(State.Hero h,
                                                         State.Target t)
        This function simulates using the Hero power to attack a certain target. Using the withMana function, to not make mistakes on the mana detraction, it heals the target if the player hero is Hillary or it damages the target if the player Hero is Trump. It then renders the state.
        Parameters:
        h - Hero
        t - Target
        Returns:
        empty optional if the action succeeded, the error message otherwise

      • damageHero

        public void damageHero(State.Hero hero,
                       int magnitude)
        This function damages the Hero sets as a target with a certain magnitude of attack points, decreasing the HP of the target. It then adds the attack to the command log.
        Parameters:
        hero - player
        magnitude - of attack

      • endTurn

        public void endTurn(State.Hero h,
                    boolean isAI)
        This function ends the current turn. If it's called by the AI it assigns the floor to the player, if it isn't it assigns the floor to the AI.
        Parameters:
        h - Hero that is calling the function
        isAI - Whether the hero that is calling the function is currently handled by the AI or not

        public void endGame(State.Hero winner)

      • getHasUsedHeroPower

        public boolean getHasUsedHeroPower()

      • autoPlayTurn

        public void autoPlayTurn(State.Hero h)
        This function serves to your satisfaction when you are feeling particularly dumb. It always plays the most expensive card it can get: it first sorts the hand in decreasing cost order, then it chooses the first one it can afford. Loops until it has mana available. Then it attacks the Hero with each card on the floor and with its hero power. When it can't do anything anymore it calls endTurn, declaring that it is an AI.
        Parameters:
        h - Hero that is being handled by the AI

      • isCreatureOnBoard

        public java.util.Optional<State.PlayedCreature> isCreatureOnBoard(CreatureCard c)
        This function determines whether the Creature is on the board or not.
        Parameters:
        c - Creature card
        Returns:
        empty optional if the card isn't on the board, returns the card otherwise
